Review: I took a night train from Mangiustau to Beyneu, arriving at 6 am. Upon disembarking, it was straightforward to find a shared taxi to the border (costing around $5-10 per person). The journey took approximately 30-40 minutes, as the road conditions were excellent and the taxi driver drove at a brisk pace. Upon reaching the border, if you are crossing on foot, you can bypass the queues quite easily. However, expect the process to take around 45 minutes to 1 hour due to various checks on both sides. After crossing the border, there are several taxis available, making it simple to arrange transportation to Nukus or Kungrad (just make sure to learn how to pronounce the city names correctly in Uzbek!). I paid $80 for the entire car ride to Nukus. While I believe I may have overpaid due to being European (which tends to inflate prices), we were in a hurry and there were two of us. However, if you're willing to wait for other passengers and share the ride, you can potentially save $20 or more each. The journey to Nukus took 8 hours and was quite intense. The old road is in a state of disrepair, while the new road is still under construction. However, the driver navigated between them as best as possible, sometimes resorting to off-road routes. It's not a relaxing trip, particularly for the first 4-5 hours.
drove past yst and it was smooth. officers were polite n helpful to foreigners. we went thru at 9pm, not so hot. took less than 60min.awesome.

The crossing takes quite a while (8 hours), because people do transport a lot and their goods are officially checked. On the Kazakh side, the officers are super polite and helpful, as we entered from Uzbekistan. We, as tourists, got great support in an not fully understood procedure.

No problem when you ride motorcycle and you're a tourist :) But still, this is a border crossing in Central Asia so it is necessary evil. This one especially in its pure state... In our case, we over-took whole queue to its beginning on Kazakh side (because we were tourists, of course) so saved aprox. 3 hours of waiting.

With motorcycle was good, we took a rainy day and in 3 hours we get out Kazakhstan e inside Uzbekistan...the uz police was nice and friendly...off course they permit us to skip all the vehicle line. If you get there with car gooooooood luuuck.....

Prechod autem. 10h. Z Kazachstanu do Uzbekistanu. Nejhorsi hranice na svete. Umyslne zdrzovani. Dokazovani moci. Korupce. Podplaceni. Drzeni lidi jako dobytek v meziprostoru 5 hodiny (vcetne malinkych deti). Chaos. Odbavili za 4h jen 20 aut na kazasske strane a za dalsich 6hodin 20 aut na Uzbecke strane. Proste se jim nechtelo delat. Katastrofa. Escape game ve sbirani bum√°≈æek. Kdyz uz vam nauctuji poplatky za prechod autem za kazdou blbost, cca 20$ (fabricke tonovani zadnich skel treba), daji vam ucet, zase jdete k jinemu okenku a zjistite, ze vam dal nizsi ucet, nez jste platili, aby si zbytek mohli nechat. Musela jsem dat jednomu pracovnikovi cigarety, aby me nechal sedet v aute s partnerem a nemusela byt 5 hodin na nohach. Absolutne nelidske zachazeni. Vyhazet cely personal a vedeni teto hranice. Uzbeci, toto je obraz vasi zeme. Prvni kontakt se statem. Pracovnici zde ziji ve vlastni zkorumpovanem state. A oni dobre vedi, ze je to jedini prechod na stovky kilometru.
